oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alvin C. York story -- drawing a bead

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rural areas; Country life; Rifles

Ganier, Albert Franklin, 1883-1973; York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Sergeant York (Motion picture); Tennessee -- Social life and customs; Appalachians (People) -- Tennessee; Rural families -- Appalachian region; Rifle practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A man in hat and glasses is lying on the ground holding a rifle, with the barrel of the rifle resting on a log. A second man is sitting to his left with a long straight stick in his left hand. Eight other men and boys also appear in the photograph in various postures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The use of barrel rests (cant blocks) or sandbags on the chunk are permitted and encouraged. Only the shooter's hand may support the butt of the rifle. No sandbags or blocks of wood are allowed under the butt of the rifle and no gloves of any kind are permitted. The butt of the rifle may not touch the ground. (Rules: 16th ALVIN C. YORK MEMORIAL SHOOT).
